Key Match Events: Ottniel Baartman dismissed Pathum Nissanka in his first over.
Anrich Nortje took career-best figures of 4-0-7-4, dismissing Kamindu Mendis, Kusal Mendis, Charith Asalanka, and Angelo Mathews.
Quinton de Kock batted for nearly an hour and scored 20, the highest individual score for South Africa.
Pre-Game Insights: The crowd of 12,500 mainly consisted of Sri Lankan expats and a mix of South Africans, Indians, English, and Trinidadians.
Post-Match Reflections: The game was played at a slow pace with only 12 boundaries, six fours, and six sixes across both innings.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The surface was described as two-paced, with some deliveries being faster than a New York minute while others barely bouncing.
The game was considered a good advert for Test cricket due to its compelling nature despite the slow scoring.
